meanings.definition: A large amount or quantity of something.
meanings.sent1: She had boodles of toys in her room.
meanings.sent2: The store had boodles of colorful balloons for sale.
meanings.sent3: The clown had boodles of tricks up his sleeve.
meanings.sent4: The garden was filled with boodles of blooming flowers.
meanings.sent5: The treasure chest was overflowing with boodles of gold coins.

meanings.definition: To have a lot of money or wealth.
meanings.sent1: After winning the lottery, he boodles enough to buy a mansion.
meanings.sent2: She boodles from her successful business ventures.
meanings.sent3: The magician boodles from his amazing performances.
meanings.sent4: The king boodles from the taxes collected from his subjects.
meanings.sent5: The entrepreneur boodles from his innovative ideas.

meanings.definition: To have a great deal of something.
meanings.sent1: The buffet restaurant boodles a variety of delicious dishes.
meanings.sent2: She boodles patience when dealing with difficult situations.
meanings.sent3: The library boodles books for every reader's taste.
meanings.sent4: The forest boodles wildlife and natural beauty.
meanings.sent5: The market boodles fresh produce every morning.
